content: The closure of the last ironworks in Merthyr Tydfil in 1901 dealt a major blow to the local economy, but the town eventually recovered through the growth of coal mining and other industries. The town continued to be an important center for coal production in the 20th century, with several new collieries opening after the closure of the ironworks. However, the decline of the coal industry in the 1980s and 90s led to high unemployment and social and economic challenges for the town. In recent years, there have been efforts to regenerate the town through initiatives like the Merthyr Tydfil Enterprise Zone and the proposed Merthyr Tydfil Energy Park. It can be said that the town has undergone several transformations throughout its industrial history, and it has shown resilience in adapting to the changing economic landscape over time.
